pr_title: Stop using Ctrl+FKey shortcuts on macOS

timeline.message:
Stop using Ctrl+FKey shortcuts on macOS

- The Ctrl+F1 through Ctrl+F8 shortcuts have existing meanings on macOS and shouldn't be used by applications
- On Mac use Cmd+F1, Cmd+F2, Cmd+F6, and Cmd+F7 instead of Ctrl+Fn
- On Mac, get rid of shortcut for Activate Connections altogether (was Ctrl+F5 and Cmd+F5 is used for VoiceOver on macOS; given nobody has cared don't think eliminating it will be a big problem and users can always add their own mapping)
- Fixes #8401

timeline.bodyText: Nit: Should we be consistent and use Cmd+F7 instead of typing out Command?
timeline.author: melissa-barca

replies.bodyText: This page is primarily used by screen-reader users (it replaces the inaccessible shortcut popup when screen-reader mode is enabled). "Command" is pronounced correctly with screen readers, but "Cmd" can have issues.
replies.author: gtritchie

replies.bodyText: Oops, I see I have some that are "cmd", let me fix that! :-)
replies.author: gtritchie
